unnormalised: Yo, car fanatics! The Indian auto market's buzzing like a Diwali firecracker with new wheels dropping left, right, and center!
normalised: Yo, car fanatics! The Indian auto market's buzzing like a Diwali firecracker with new wheels dropping left, right, and center!

unnormalised: First up, Mahindra just unleashed their Bolero Neo+ – a proper workhorse. Think tougher than a Lagaan-era bullock cart, but with AC! Starting at around Rs. 11.49 Lakh, it’s aiming straight for the heart of rural India.
normalised: First up, Mahindra just unleashed their Bolero Neo plus – a proper workhorse. Think tougher than a Lagaan era bullock cart, but with A C! Starting at around rupee eleven point four nine lakh, it’s aiming straight for the heart of rural India.

unnormalised: Then, Tata Motors surprised everyone with a facelifted Harrier. This SUV’s got more tech than ISRO these days, plus it looks slicker than a Bollywood hero after a dance number.
normalised: Then, Tata Motors surprised everyone with a facelifted Harrier. This S U V’s got more tech than I S R O these days, plus it looks slicker than a Bollywood hero after a dance number.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, some sources say Maruti Suzuki is gearing up to launch the next-gen Swift sometime in 2024. Dr. Sharma from IIT Madras even speculated about a possible hybrid version with improved fuel efficiency, maybe clocking 25 kmpl!
normalised: Meanwhile, some sources say Maruti Suzuki is gearing up to launch the next-gen Swift sometime in two thousand and twenty four. Doctor Sharma from I I T Madras even speculated about a possible hybrid version with improved fuel efficiency, maybe clocking twenty five kilometer per liter!

unnormalised: But the real news? Some leaked images show what looks like a concept of a new homegrown electric vehicle from Ola. Rumors swirling it will have panoramic sunroof and sprawling 500 sq ft of interior space (okay, maybe not *that* much interior space!). Stay tuned for more updates!
normalised: But the real news? Some leaked images show what looks like a concept of a new homegrown electric vehicle from Ola. Rumors swirling it will have panoramic sunroof and sprawling five hundred square feet of interior space okay, maybe not that much interior space! Stay tuned for more updates!
